website_summaries.verdict: A handy blood pressure monitor with useful features for a household device.
pros: Comes with a nice carry case for safe storage and travel
Backlit screen allows for nighttime or low-light readings
Can store and organize two separate user profiles in one device
cons: Can be frustrating for daily use as batteries deplete quickly

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: After reading my previous 2 star review because of a defective monitor , Greater Goods contacted me several times to rectify my unhappy purchase . They quickly sent me a replacement monitor . I received it today , and all the functions operate . The previous monitor had a defect where the arm positioning assistant would not work at all which made me skeptical of the blood pressure readings . I am fairly confident now that the new replacement monitor is giving me good readings . Thank you Greater Goods !
customer_reviews.author: Mark Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Great compact size & works just as good as my bulky arm cuff monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, easy to use, & accurate. Set up was a breeze they even include a link to a helpful set up video. Love the indicator that tells you when your wrist is in the correct position. It’s a great size for taking with you when necessary. This has already replaced my bulkier monitor. I compared results of the two & they both gave me similar results so I know it works (I had previously taken my larger monitor to the doctors office so he could compare & make sure it gave accurate results.). I would definitely recommend this. Great little monitor especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Bobby’s mom

customer_reviews.title: Resets if you hold it a certain way, stopped working at a week
customer_reviews.text: At first we would pick it up by holding the top and bottom of the unit. Now and then it would reset (the date and all recorded readings would be erased). It turned out that when we held the top and bottom of the unit, sometimes the pressure if our grip caused the reset ): While initially the device appeared to work very well, except for the resetting issue, it stopped pressurizing the cuff after about a week. We replaced the batteries, the issue did not go away. Dead after a week.
customer_reviews.author: Patritata

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Foolproof Product
customer_reviews.text: As close to flawless as one might get in a home health product. The company supplies clear, detailed instructions and ready online support. However, it is simplicity itself to use and completely self-guided. Strap it on your wrist as shown, angle your arm according to the real-time feedback, and bingo, you have your heart rate and blood pressure in seconds. Amazing! I can't testify to its accuracy or consistency, but my readings were in the same range as in my online medical history, so it's looking good. Even the packaging reflects thought and care. All in all, a great product and great value.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Constantine

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Tool
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who needs to track blood pressure daily and need and a backup unit for travel, this is your unit. I already have an arm cuff unit that I use daily, but wanted to see how drastically the measurements differ. The first couple of days the measurements were off before I realize that I was not placing the cuff exactly where I had been instructed. After making that slight adjusting, beginning day 3, the numbers were almost aligned, not quite, but not enough to cause me any concern. I was quite pleased. What I liked most of all was the automatic arm placement that starts measurement immediately. I would highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Nice Basic Wrist BP Cuff
customer_reviews.text: For less that 20 dollars this little guy is accurate and easy to use. I am very happy with it. My doc wanted me to have one and my insurance did not want to pay for it. The pharmacy sells cuffs too but at about 3 times the price. I bought this one and the doc thinks its fine and almost on the money with the doctors. I will say I have "tiny" wrists for a woman and it is great for me, but a man or woman with large wrists may not be able to get it around their wrist. It definitely isn't for large or "plus" sized people. Keep that in mind before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Meezer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to do but very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor. It does what it’s supposed to do and you can store 2 people’s bp info in it. It has a user 1 and user 2 option. The only thing I don’t like is that you have to get it in just the right spot or the reading is off by a few numbers. It’s very sensitive and very difficult to keep it in the green section
customer_reviews.author: mar

customer_reviews.title: Compact size, very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I already own the Balance cuff monitor (which I love) but I wanted something that is more compact/transportable while being just as easy to use. When I got this unit I compared the results with the cuff model and the readings are consistently in the same range with the wrist model generally being a little lower. The unit is very easy to use and I love that the instruction book is very comprehensive as is the video on the website. I particularly like that the display has a prompt that shows if your arm is in the correct position with arrows pointing the way to move it if it's not.
customer_reviews.author: TLH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic BP monitor! Sooooo easy to use with time stamps as well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I previously purchased a scale from Greater Goods and am very pleased with it. This blood pressure monitor is incredibly user-friendly and even has time stamps when storing your readings. Also, Greater Goods gives part of their sales to various charities around the globe. Thank you! Will definitely be buying from your company in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: A Great Company and the BEST customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Wrist Blood Pressure Monitor Cuff form Greater Goods and had problems with it right out of the box. Within a day or two, Nick from Customer Service contacted me just to see how my monitor was working. I explained that I had a problem with it and Nick sent out replacement immediately. I couldn't ask for better service than that. A part of every purchase from Greater Goods is donated to a wonderful charity, Love146. I am so impressed with this company! Thanks Greater Goods, thanks Nick!
customer_reviews.author: Snappy Dan DiMasi

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and compact
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel BPM, very compact and informative. Like most of these wrist BPMs it can be picky on how high or low you raise your wrist to get an accurate reading. It might cause it to show a higher or lower reading compared to arm cuff BPMs, but the little wrist guide icon displayed on it does help position it. I still prefer the arm cuff type for its ease of use and accuracy but this one will definitely be used while travelling and at work due to its awesome compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Carlex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As a CNA for over 30 years I never trusted wrist blood pressure cuffs before. Accuracy is greatly affected by placement on the wrist. Now I need one to keep up with my blood pressure at home since I am retired due to congestive heart failure. This cuff makes it impossible to use it incorrectly. I just read the paper manual which came with it, and it was easy to understand and use. I am very pleased with this cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Oliver

customer_reviews.title: It really works and is accurate
customer_reviews.text: This BP monitor is easy to operate and is accurate. I compared with with the Omron--the type used in clinical settings. The symbol on the monitor ensures accurate positioning to effect a precise measurement. I've only had it for 2 weeks and it was small and light enough to take with me on vacation. Hopefully, it has longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Osaj

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Love the arm positioning feature on this monitor. I was always uncertain of how to position my arm to get a correct reading. Turns out I was pretty far off as this device does not inflate until you are in the correct position and I had been raising my arm too high. Took it with me to my annual check-up to compare to the doctor's bp cuff. Came pretty close to the professional one. I would recommend this if you need to monitor your blood pressure.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Really Good BP Cuff
customer_reviews.text: This blood pressure cuff works very well. It is simple to use, quick and easy to put on and take off, and is a accurate as the upper arm BP cuff I have. The irregular heartbeat indicator is also very valuable (it caught and diagnosed mine). This is a good product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan Barcus

customer_reviews.title: You will not get an accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this product because it never gives an accurate reading. I check my blood pressure daily. I always received high reading so I made a doctors appointment and brought the machine in the office with me. I had my doctor check my pressure 3 times , all 3 times the machine gave me a completely different reading from my results that the doctors took. She told me to trash it because it was garbage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look no further....
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about a wrist blood pressure cuff, but the reviews were good and the price was great so I ordered. To my delight, this little machine is fantastic and spot on accurate! Order this for yourself and give it to anyone you know that needs to monitor their BP!
customer_reviews.author: Allison M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but not accurate, false normal results
customer_reviews.text: I used this wrist blood pressure monitor for over a year and I was initially happy that my BP was okay but I noticed at doctors offices my BP was high. First I thought from stress of doctor visit but I compared it with one other wrist BP monitor and one arm BP monitor which showed similar to the doctor's results while this monitor continued to show lower than the other 3. I don't recommend this monitor unless the manufacturer addressed the accuracy issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ayhan Calis

customer_reviews.title: The Best Blood Pressure Unit for Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my PCP said I should be checking my BP regularly. I thought the wrist type would be easier to use. However there are certain aspects that don’t work for someone 5’ tall. I can’t sit with my back against the back of a normal chair and put my feet flat on the floor. I still use it, because using an upper arm one is problematic. Since the BP level I got with with this was practically the same as what the PA at my doctor’s office got using an upper arm one, I’ll stick with what’s easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrist Cuff BP Monitor very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a regular BP upper arm monitor but took the opportunity to try the wrist cuff. Love the ease of use. Read someone saying it ended up being painfully tight; that was not my experience at all. This went up to around 155, not 240, and, yes, it was tight . . . but not bad. The wrist cuff is compact, easy to store, and far easier to use than traditional BP monitors. I like the Bluetooth function of the GreaterGoods upper arm monitor, but I'm willing to sacrifice that app history of a quick read of my blood pressure with the wrist cuff. Great price; great product.
customer_reviews.author: papermaven

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the ingenious and helpful hand position assistant that guides you on positioning your arm height, so the wrist is aligned with your heart. Also, this unit is so compact which makes it very suitable for travel if you want to keep up with your BP readings while you're away on vacation. In my case the readings were not the same as the traditional arm based BP monitors, they're consistently lower, so I can just approximate the BP which may good enough for most people. Please don't take my word for it, check with your doctor :-)
customer_reviews.author: pardos

customer_reviews.title: Great BPM for Home or Travel
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this BPM cuff. It fits comfortably and is incredibly easy to use. The app interface is simple and easy to work in. The cuff itself is pretty self-explanatory and the directions provided by GG in both the included booklet and website are easy-to-follow. I've been looking for something like this for a while and I am so excited to have this cuff! This is really going to help me better communicate with my PCP and I can't wait to show them! Thank you for a great product at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Robbie K. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about accuracy....
customer_reviews.text: I like this product even though it does use a lot of battery power to operate. I gave it 3 stars because even though many of the reviews say they are getting accurate readings, I’m finding my readings off by about 10 points systolic and diastolic. I have started checking my blood pressure manually because the wrist cuff readings are too low. Not sure if I have one that needs calibration ...? Not sure if I would advise someone to use readings from this device unless mine is defective.
customer_reviews.author: rijbaklvr

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I really like products from Greater Goods and this wrist monitor did not disappoint. As someone stated before, it is compact, easy to use, and accurate. I bought it for my 90 year old mother but I tried it out before I gave it to her. My first reading was a bit high but then I learned to use the indicator that points you to the correct position. Readings then became more accurate. My mother has not had any problems using it and she really likes it. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: It's so easy to use. And easy on the eyes👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: tacobell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome BP cuff and equally great price
customer_reviews.text: Very handy and easy to use. Doesn’t hurt like BP cuffs for the upper arm. Great product and buy. Has an app to log readings for doctors appointments. The monitor itself also keeps track of readings. Wish I had purchased one sooner! Thanks for the great product!
customer_reviews.author: ANGinAZ

customer_reviews.title: convenient
customer_reviews.text: Its great! It goes right on your wrist, its not bulky and hard to maneuver. It also shows your heart rate..
customer_reviews.author: shamrock

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to monitor my blood pressure after a high score at the dentist office (also a wrist monitor). It caused quite the scare so I scheduled a doctor appt who told me my BP was just fine. She recommended I return the wrist monitor and purchase one that goes on your arm. I really liked how easy it was to use and the app you can download to track your BP, so I purchased the arm monitor from this same company.
customer_reviews.author: KAM

customer_reviews.title: Great until it died
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great until it didn’t. I had it a couple months and then it just started doing all kinds of goofy crap the display started going and you couldn’t read it. Tried new batteries and eventually threw it out. It was cool while it lasted but I never dropped it never damaged it and it just gave out for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I went through 10 different batteries (both new and taken out of other, running, devices) and got a battery low error message for all of them. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Meri A.

customer_reviews.title: Slow Slow SLOW! Shuts off before reading BP. :(
customer_reviews.text: I’m an RN and this is not quick or easy to use. The screen shuts off and doesn’t read the bp... extremely disappointing since i need this to work while I take other vital signs for the patient. I CAN NOT be standing there fiddling with basic equipment.
customer_reviews.author: California RN

customer_reviews.title: Anything but this brand!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, horrible, horrible! Don’t be fooled by the low price. I Manage a nursing home type business, bought the arm BP monitor and cuff, broke within 2 weeks, bought the wrist BP monitor and cuff, broke in 3 days. The current one I have, I got at Walgreens for the same price, it has been working perfectly for months. I don’t know what it is about this brand, but they both broke the exact same way (they would start to fill up with air, then stop after a few seconds showing an error sign). We are all medical professionals and know how to use this equipment. Just sub par machines.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Blood Pressure Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great simple device. No hose or cuffs to deal with. Simple, very cost effective, and user friendly to utilize. I would highly recommend giving the monitor a try.
customer_reviews.author: J L Henderson III

customer_reviews.title: Great compact BP monitor
customer_reviews.text: This came with everything, including a travel bag to store it in and even batteries! In order for it to give you an accurate reading your arm must be in the correct position. (there's even a website that you can go to, it will walk you through it!) I like that it can store readings for 2 people, so that my husband and I can both use it. It's very easy to read, another plus.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly841

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, accurate!!
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to use and even came with batteries! I was able to get started and take an accurate blood pressure reading on myself with just the guide on the cuff itself in less than 5 minutes! I haven’t set up the other features yet like the date and time but I’m sure this will be equally easy with the guide provided. Excellent, simple to use product and love that it doesn’t have a cord to get tangled up in!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Wells

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The velcro strip gave out almost immediately after I started using it. When I take my blood pressure I have to hold the grip in place. Hopefully that doesn't affect the reading. The item is still working as far as the mechanic end of it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Updated review
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: Due to my line of work, this cuff was not sufficient for my patient population (hospice), but I was contacted by the company & offered a replacement which was a much better option for me & has worked like a charm ever since! Shoutout to everyone who helped correct my problem! Customer service: 10 stars!
customer_reviews.author: D. Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t hold up
customer_reviews.text: I originally wrote a good review on this cuff without giving it enough time to see how it held up. Overall, I felt it had accurate readings but the cuff stopped working Before 2 months of use. Very disappointed since it only got used not even 3 days out of the week. I was going to reach out to the company but decided to cut my loses. Just keep this in mind if you decided to buy. Will invest in a better kind next time.
customer_reviews.author: Puffin18

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, light weight & portable.
customer_reviews.text: Just got my blood pressure cuff a few days ago. Packaged very well! Seems to be good quality! Readings so far were pretty accurate to what I get at the doctors office. It was a little hard to set up users so I gave up on that but other than that so far so good. Love that it’s light weight and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Not usable
customer_reviews.text: As I had sort of suspected it would be, this item is junk. It squeezes your wrist so hard till it you think either the device or your wrist will go. And after that it doesn't give you a measurement. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Better than most blood pressure cuffs!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for an accurate and consistent blood pressure cuff and this is one of the best ones I have found for our office. The only complaint is that it will not read on a select few patients or when the battery gets low the readings are a little less accurate, but other than that most readings have been spot on.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Real simple product to use. I wish it would let one upload CSV spreadsheet to upload manual entries to the free app that one can use on their phone. It let's one export out one's data to a CSV spreadsheet to one's email, which is not working for me. The best feature for me besides the backlighting on the display is the arm elevation is correct for an accurate reading.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Adams

customer_reviews.title: A very smart robot!
customer_reviews.text: So smart it knows when you need to raise or lower your arm to be in alignment with your heart! Also very sensitive to moving around during measurements. Good things I think! Very nice and effective. Doesn’t overinflated like others do, but measures from the bottom up apparently, as it quits once the upper (Systolic) pressure is reached! Now that’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miles

customer_reviews.title: It's not as accurate as the arm pressure monitor
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept, taking a reading from one's wrist is much easier than the upper arm. The monitor that uses the arm cuff has only one height size for the cuff (though it does have two lengths) so I was hoping for a wrist version that might more easily fit my small size. Unfortunately, the readings on the wrist monitor were consistently higher in the upper number (by about 10 points) than the readings using the monitor with an arm cuff. The arm cuff monitor was checked for accuracy against my doctor's machine just a couple weeks ago, so I know it's accurate. The lower number was also a little higher but no more than 5 points.
customer_reviews.author: CY

customer_reviews.title: Nope, just nope
customer_reviews.text: Blood Pressure is completely off. Compared it to my Omron series 7, the readings are all over the place. Plus when I took the batteries out they were really hot...going back!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit, But a Couple of Small Glitches
customer_reviews.text: It is accurate when compared to the one at the doctor's office. I take my BP three times a day and I'm lucky if I can get 5 days of battery life out of it. Also, there are times when I have to raise and lower my arm several times before it starts to take a reading. Would rechargeable batteries work? All in all I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Tombeaux

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it long enough to evaluate durability but so far loving this unit. Faster, quieter and less annoying than the upper arm unit I was using. The arm position sensor makes it simple to position correctly for good readings. Accuracy seems very good in relation to my upper arm unit. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Drew400

customer_reviews.title: This BP machine is not good at all
customer_reviews.text: Not please with BP machine at all the batteries provided for the cuff were dead also after u place the cuff on the left wrist as instructed hold your arm at the right angle as soon on the screen of the machine it never pumps or inflates to read your BP after several trys and changing to new batteries x2 the machine gives a EO1 error reading this product does not work I would rate the product as no stars
customer_reviews.author: shakeira

customer_reviews.title: Pretty close to manual readings
customer_reviews.text: I have found this BP cuff to be more accurate than most. I have always done BPs manually and so I compared my manual readings with this cuff and they were close. #gamechanger
customer_reviews.author: MomOf3

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Use this often to monitor my pressure. Works well and easy to use. Not sure how accurate it is but it works as long as you sit up straight and align wrist with your heart.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Blood pressure cuff
customer_reviews.text: I have bought from this company before & was so very pleased I bought from them again. I was completely pleased again!! They have high quality items that are affordable. This bp cuff is easy to use. The screen is easy to read & it saves the bp readings. I highly recommend this product & this company! !
customer_reviews.author: Julie Frazee

customer_reviews.title: Effective BP machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine is very positional. Results are accurate but you have to manipulate patients arm to make machine happy before it give BP results
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly accurate!
customer_reviews.text: This BP monitor surprised me. After I figured out the correct placement/position on my wrist, it's almost the exact same numbers as my arm cuff. I don't use this with the android app however, because I was already using the app with the arm cuff version.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Smith

customer_reviews.title: BP Monitor works as described
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is easy to use and works as it should. Its readings are on par with those of my doctor's. The instructions are easy to follow, but must be followed for accurate readings. Once accustomed to using it, the product is simple to use, and effective. I recommend it to anyone looking to track their blood pressure.
customer_reviews.author: F.J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use little blood pressure cuff
customer_reviews.text: I found this cuff to be extremely easy to use and the results seem to be reliable in comparison with two other blood pressure cuffs I have. I also appreciate how small it is. Not having the long tube connecting the cuff to the pump/readout makes it much more portable. Update: The cuff is so small I take whenever I travel. It is so simple and quick to use.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy S. Hare

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, and extremely portable.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this blood pressure monitor to be used mainly on our trips to the country side, for some of our relatives who suffer from high blood pressure. It has demonstrated to be super accurate, and very easy to use even for the most tech resistant old people from our family and group. It is very sturdy and well constructed. Battery life is also another plus for this device.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lara Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: don't seem to be accurate
customer_reviews.text: I am talking about when compare with my Omron blood pressure monitors. it reads 10 points less on both high and low blood pressures.
customer_reviews.author: G. X

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago haven’t had any issues yet but recently doesn’t seem to work well. I will definitely be calling the company since there is a two year warranty on it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great cuff, eats batteries like there's no tomorrow.
customer_reviews.text: Great cuff... Very easy to operate. The only thing I dislike about this is how fairly I have to change batteries. I'm changing batteries WEEKLY. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is pretty fantastic! Device is accurate, easy to use, and much more convenient than an arm cuff. I do wish it was Bluetooth for the added convenience but no stars removed because that wasn't something it came with. I did receive this item for free or discounted as part of a survey request.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 2 weeks and then I when I had to change the batteries with NEW batteries it says I need to change them, no matter how many new batteries I go thru each time it says the power is low. No longer keeps an accurate bp and I’m 6 days behind the return date. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: This BP monitor has everything that you need to keep track of your blood pressure and heart rate plus it will remember 2 different user's so myself and my husband can use it and keep track of our levels. I would highly recommend this monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Simple and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This BP monitor is simple to use; I was skeptical about the accuracy of wrist (versus upper arm) BP monitors, but this one gave the same reading as my larger upper arm unit. Very happy with the unit, and it's offered at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: just some guy

customer_reviews.title: Velcro stopped working after 5 months!
customer_reviews.text: This started out as a great cuff to use for my home infusion RN job. But, I am 5 months in and the velcro will not hold at all giving me the error signal every time unless myself or the patient holds it secure. Great device, but not for longevity!
customer_reviews.author: CO Bike Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I have ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, is this easy to operate. The directions are simple, it runs on 2 AAA batteries, the readout is clear and there is no awful squishing of the upper arm, only slight pressure on the wrist. You can take the unit on and off one handed. It is quite accurate. This is perfect for my 90 year old mom, who wants to monitor her pressure, but hates all the screwing around with an upper arm cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Denise DeMars

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it very long but it is easy to set and use. This is my first BP monitor but appears to be fairly accurate and a lot less expensive that other ones offered. I like that the company appears to be socially responsible.
customer_reviews.author: Zen Nana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to read results.
customer_reviews.text: I like the brightly lit, easy to read screen on this blood pressure monitor. The monitor also helps you position your arm for the best reading. Fits the wrist comfortably. Saves your results. Comes with batteries and a drawstring carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lake

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes struggle to get my upper arm BP monitor tight and in the correct position. I find the wrist monitor much easier to use and the position monitors take the guess work out of weather or not you are in the correct position to get an accurate reading.The small size makes it easier to travel with. I have other products from Greater Good and have been very satisfied. I did have and issue with one of the devices and all I can say their customer service is AMAZING! Plus their community involvement with the Love146 fight trafficking is icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF W

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use blood pressure reader
customer_reviews.text: Like this product so far. It’s well made with clear digital readings. I also like that it records previous blood pressure readings for two users.
customer_reviews.author: John51

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Easy to Operate, Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Compact, accurate. It tells you to either raise or lower your arm, before it will work, so you have it at the heart level, for accurate read. I love it. Best wrist monitor I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great blood pressure machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice blood pressure cuff it is small easy to use and to carry with me. Fits perfectly for both me and my husband. It is accurate and easy to read definitely like this much better than the one that goes up my arm
customer_reviews.author: Gale Lewandowski

customer_reviews.title: quality and appearence
customer_reviews.text: My doctor suggested I get one of these blood pressure monitors since my BP is a little high. This device works really well, and I can now keep track of my readings from home. This is a nice quality product, I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: prefect for what i needed, video helped with setup, awesome product
customer_reviews.author: Leeona

customer_reviews.title: Best portable BPM
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something portable that I could take anywhere and got this one and it is working just great, it also tells you how to position your arm correctly so the results are accurate. Nice! Will gladly recommend it to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Manny G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The first BP Monitor Cuff did not function properly, I contacted Greater Goods on their website and communicated with Katy. She immediately told me I would be sent a replacement. Within a few days it was received. It works great! The set up and usage is super easy. Love the customer service. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marion J Ortego

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It works great and is easy to read but I wish it were rechargeable instead of battery operated.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Schomer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for your money
customer_reviews.text: Similar to other ones purchased before. Having a backlit unit is a must when it comes to chose the right device. It beats a standard LCD device and a flashlight when used in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and read.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had taken my blood pressure at store and showed very high so I wanted to be able to check it. This is so easy to use. But I will say something I didn't know it has Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: sherri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: We love that it's small & fits on the wrist. The claps in the band gives you a great fit to taking your blood pressure as to the original ones.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Wrist monitor not as accurate!
customer_reviews.text: The wrist monitor is not accurate like the normal arm cuff. Company- Greater Goods were really helpful and allowed me to trade out for a arm cuff. The arm cuff is amazing! Works the best, and had bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: #1 Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blood pressure cuff less than a year ago. Worked great, easy to use and pretty accurate. Suddenly it has stopped working. No longer happy.
customer_reviews.author: joinme4coffee

customer_reviews.title: Just think before  you  buy anything  what's been around  and what ant
customer_reviews.text: I don't like it it's not that accurate on reading sometime it does but most of the time it's way to high I had to buy another one and this one goes around your arm and it's very good and accurate do I wouldn't recommend this type to no one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good travel cuff - small and super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have the regular cuff from Greater Goods and the wrist cuff. The wrist cuff is small and it is super easy to use. I find that the measurements for me tend to run lower than what I get from the cuff so I would say it is not as accurate as the cuff. Because it is so small and portable, I would not hesitate to take this with me when I travel while I would not do that with the cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R. Hebda

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great, is very accurate and quiet. I take my blood pressure a lot more now than i did with a big clunky machine i had to plug in. Fits my wrist at 8.5 inches too.
customer_reviews.author: ashley h

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, seems to have an intelligence that my others did not have. A bit different in procedure but has a consistency that is very acceptable. Thank you for a good one.
customer_reviews.author: pamtexas53

customer_reviews.title: Always accurate
customer_reviews.text: I took this to my doctor as soon as I got it and I take it to every appointment just to check it’s accuracy and it’s always spot on. It does go through batteries really fast though.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great for nursing students. Much easier to carry around than my manual cuff. Easy to use and read and helps my patients understand and read their own vital signs. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: QueenAnne

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased more expensive cuffs in the past but this is by far the best and most accurate
customer_reviews.author: addesa55

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate at all.
customer_reviews.text: Three different readings during in minutes. Readings vary up to 30 points. Plus batteries died in three days.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but keeps sending me errors
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this item and I was so excited to find one that has great reviews at an affordable price but I’m overall disappointed with the item :( it’s showing inaccurate blood pressure (compared to my doctor taking it) and it’s loud and doesn’t inflate with air for me. I’m following the instruction booklet on how to use it but it also keeps sending me to an error screen and shutting off. Sounds like a hit or miss item but I’m so happy other people are enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Good acuuracy. Easy to use. Bought for 88 yr old super active Mom and she usrs with ease. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Tony&Mia

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect BP monitor. Easy to use and read. Better than the typical cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device! It is very easy to use and accurate. I also like that it is lightweight and easy to travel with. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: innacurate
customer_reviews.text: i use one at work and the two don't add up at all, the company sent me replacement but that one was innacurate as well. like not even close
customer_reviews.author: EJ Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, it came with batteries and a little pouch to carry it in. I looked at several and read lots of reviews before I purchased this one and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Page

customer_reviews.title: compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This blood pressure cuff is easier to use than traditional cuffs. It is small and compact. It can easily fit in your purse or briefcase. It is less noticeable to take your blood pressure than regular cuffs. It can even track previous blood pressure measurements. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Rehfeld-Brown

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, Easy To Use Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, easy to use monitor. I love the small siz and that it gives the same range of BP readings as my Balance arm cuff unit. It is easy to see the previous readings for transferring data to the Balance app in a group of readings. It would be great if it also connected via Bluetooth but not having that feature does help keep the cost low and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super. Screen.  Great. Value.  High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I. Love ❤️ thr. Bright. Blue Screen and. Big. Numbers in Bright White. To take Good Pictures of it with my Telephone. Also. Easy to set up. And. Doesn’t pressure your wrist too much like the Arm Blood Pressure Monitors
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, large numbers
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day. Seems to be accurate enough when compared to the calibrated unit. Batteries last well.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie K Jaques

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great no machine! I ordered it for my husband so that we could get daily bp checks because or old machine that we had no longer worked. This is great
customer_reviews.author: Caneka💜

product_meta.title: GreaterGoods Wrist Blood Pressure Monitor, Call Help Desk for Support (2020 Updated) Large Cuff, Batteries and Warranty Included, (Wrist BPM)
feature_bullets: ACCURATE MEASUREMENTS: FDA-cleared for trustworthy operation. Not-Connected. View our setup guide for best results.
PERSONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE: If you have questions about your product, we have real people here to take your call. 2-YEAR WARRANTY: Covers damage and defects. Follow AHA guidelines.

EASY-TO-READ DISPLAY: Large LCD screen with oversize numbers is readable at a glance, even in low-light conditions. MULTIPLE USERS: Two different users can store their blood pressure history on this device.
ONE-SIZE-FITS-ALL: Comfortable cuff fits users with wrist circumferences from 13.5 cm to 21.5 cm each. PORTABLE: Compact and easy to store.
COMMUNITY: At Greater Goods, we’re committed to making great products that give back. A piece of each Balance purchase helps our charity partner Love146.
